description.narrative: The United Nations Office foe the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) is running the Regional Humanitarian Partnerships Workshop to be held in August 2010 in Jakarta and will involve participation from governments, Non-Government Organisations (NGOs) and disaster management organisations from across the Asia Pacific. OCHA aims to promote a better coordinated, more equitably supported international humanitarian response system as well as providing a leading role in humanitarian policy, advocacy and information management. This funding will contribute to strengthened disaster preparedness and response capacity in the Asia Pacific region ficusing on humanitarian partnerships. The workshop aims to enhance participants knowledge of on the benefits of effective inter-agency coordination for disaster preparedness, response and recovery and also to show the group that participation in the system will ultimately work towards a more responsive regional mechanism for inter-agency coordination for disaster preparedness, response and recovery. The total value of this initiative is $0.2 million expenced in the 2009-10 financial year.
